comment: For online calc 1 she doesn't really teach at all, no lectures, no study guides, resources are all other youtube videos, so be prepared to teach the topics yourself from the textbook and youtube videos. Tests are online through teams and can be difficult but are not too complicated. She can be a harsh grader but is pretty fair. Final is in person.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr.Azizi is great professor and very nice. Make sure to do well on the homework and quizzes as tests make up most of your grade. Make sure to cover everything in the lectures as it might show up on the tests. The class is not easy so you need to study in advance. However, there are practise exams that will do a decent amount of catch up.

Asma is amazing! She posts her lecture notes online after class, but she goes over it well in class too. HW helps to supplement learning. Quizzes and tests are predictable. She provides a lot of extra credit and is very kind and approachable. Low key funny too, you have to pay attention but she cracks some funny jokes in class. Hidden gem at KSU!

Professor Azizi was an excellent lecturer. She made difficult concepts such as vector spaces and Gram-Schmidt easy to understand. She is very diligent and uploads and grades everything very quickly. Her lecture notes and work examples were top tier. Highly recommended!
Dr. Azizi really just wants you to succeed and will help you out in whatever topic you need help in. She offers a lot of chances to earn bonus points.

I absolutely adored Dr. Azizi! She made the exams and quizzes very similar to work examples and homework questions, which were not too difficult either. She made the material very doable and was always providing opportunities for bonus points every chance she got. Although attendance is not mandatory, please show up for her class! She's worth it!

Do NOT take this professor if you WANT TO LEARN Linear Algebra. She is super lazy and does the bare minimum. SHE STOPS THE EXAMPLES HALFWAY BECAUSE SHE'S TIRED! She doesn't provide any deeper knowledge on the subject other than a word-for-word definition from the textbook. If you ask her to explain what she writes, she'll just say "I don't know".

She really tries to make sure every single student understands the material and she is very open to answering any questions you have. There are quizzes every other week and they are some of the easiest I have ever taken. They are only one or two questions long. I have a 101 in the class so that has to say something.

Very kind and caring professor. It was her 1st time teaching Num Met and imo Num Met is an annoying class to take, but she did a great job at breaking down concepts slowly and some nice examples. She has a slight language barrier, but it doesn't affect her class at all. 110% would recommend

Professor Azizi was very understanding. I took her Spring 2022, it was her second time teaching ODE and she carefully explained each topic. She uploaded notes and went over them in class. She was really good as it was my second time taking ODE as it is hard. But, she really helped me understand ODE. Any time she is available, take her.

Great professor.  She shows a genuine concern for her students and cares if you understand the material.  There is no book, so pay attention and take notes.  Do not hesitate to ask questions.  Do the homework, take notes, and you will be fine on the tests.  I immediately signed up for her class the next semester without hesitation.

Great professor!! She wants all of her students to succeed.  She was available during her office hours and would schedule online through teams if needed.  She's fair with grading and gives participation points if you're in class.  I advise to go to class even though it's not required. It was very helpful for my grade.

One of my favorite professors. I could not imagine a better professor for learning ODE. She is tough but fair and really tries to help you understand the material if you make the effort. I typically enjoy math so I may be biased, but she creates a great learning environment so even those that struggle with numbers should find her class navigable.

If you want to learn something take her. 1 assignment a week .like 6 quizzes, two test, and attendance. Just show up to class , complete homework, take time to understand different variation of each topic for the test, and you'll be golden.
